International Science and Education Competitive Grants Program (ISE)

The ISE program provides grants supporting research, extension, and teaching activities that will enhance the capabilities of American colleges and universities to conduct international collaborative research, extension and teaching.

ISE projects are expected to:

  • enhance the international content of curricula;
  • ensure that faculty work beyond the U.S. and bring lessons learned back home;
  • promote international research partnerships;
  • enhance the use and application of foreign technologies in the U.S.; and
  • strengthen the role that colleges and universities play in maintaining U.S. competitiveness.

Click here for more information: http://www.csrees.usda.gov/fo/educationinternationalscience.cfm
